symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.severity: Variable, can range from mild to severe
symptoms.pattern: Burning, aching, jabbing; can be constant or intermittent; may persist for weeks, months, or even years

symptoms.name: Numbness
symptoms.pattern: May occur in the affected area

symptoms.name: Fatigue
symptoms.pattern: Can be significant, even without strenuous activity

symptoms.name: Depression
symptoms.pattern: Can be a consequence of chronic pain

physical_findings: Painful rash (shingles) may be present initially, but resolves before the onset of postherpetic neuralgia
Tenderness to palpation in the affected dermatome
risk_factors: Weakened immune system (e.g., due to chemotherapy)

required: Persistent pain in the dermatome affected by the previous shingles outbreak lasting longer than 4 months after resolution of the rash
supportive: Physical examination findings consistent with postherpetic neuralgia
Absence of other causes of neuropathic pain
